Message.Title: Getanid - why do you hide??
Message.Msg: Repeat: I'm still waiting for a substantive reply over 7 words?? What would Apple do if they fall behind in performance in the future?? Would they still stick with sub-par performance in order to keep the Apple experience?? I hope you don't mind me using 2 questions marks like you do??

Chitown, I think your questions are legitimate, even though there is no clear cut answer possible now. However, by the end of the year, we might be in a better position to #$%$ how much of a performance gap there is between Apple Ax and Tegra 4/5, if any, and which one is leading. As you mentioned, if there is enough of a performance gap in favor of the Tegra SoCs, anything is possible - even Samsung could come back to NV as a customers. NEVER SAY NO ON SUNDAY - in a different context.

An additional point: Tim Cook would have less of a tech ego, being basically an operations guy - in comparison with Steve Jobs. Cook would worry less about whether Apple uses a technology not :home grown" as long as the profit margin can be withstood. This should potentially open a psychological door to external suppliers who offer high performance/low cost parts.

""we might be in a better position to #$%$ how much ...." It should read: " We might be in a better position to #$%$ how much..." NOt sure why Yahoo changed the word "#$%$" to #$%$ - since when "#$%$" has become a dirty word?
For heaven's sake, Yahoo, your filtering SW is stupid. I meant to use the word "a.s.s.e.s.s", not a.s.s.x.x.....you have a dirty mind, mate!
" I'm still waiting for a substantive reply over 7 words??" count them: Repeat: When does your fantasy of Apple using Tegra happen ?? When do you accept reality that it won't happen ??

The Apple Swift core has performance/clockspeed in between an ARM A9 and A15. Apple obviously did not feel threatened enough by Tegra 3 which had double the A9 cores of its A5 chip to go Tegra 3. If it wants to add more performance it can produce a quad-core Swift chip and up the clockspeed on process shrinks. Apple is more likely to go Atom than Tegra as how could Nvidia guarantee it the volumes anyway but neither is likely now it has gone down the path of building its own ARM core which no doubt it will continue doing at 64-bit. Everybody else can forget doing Apple's chips especially as it is clearly negotiating fab space at TSMC for Swift production at 28nm and 20nm and lower.
Apple will get any capacity leftover from their top customers. Only when they get done with any expansion will Apple be delegated sufficient volume.
I'm still waiting??
I hear there is a lot of capacity available right now in Intel Fabs?
nice update

LOL. No, TSMC will negotiate guaranteed wafer volume for Apple just like Samsung did who built a fab in the US for Apple which tells you all you need to know about how far foundries will bend over backwards to get the production volume of the world's richest IT company. TSMC knows if it does not then Intel or Globalfoundries or even Samsung again will take the Apple business. Apple ARM chips are the only ones I could see Intel fabbing as they are in a proprietary ecosystem which Atoms on Android/Windows don't really directly compete against for o/s sockets.

Topic.Title: for nvda MWC is worse than zero design wins

Message.Msg: with zero design wins for WMC, Vizio was the last chance. Can you image the pressure on those FAEs to get Vizio's tablet working?? Bet you Jen personally chained them to the work benches two months before MWC to get the prototype to work. Still, they failed. That tells much about the state of development for Tegra 4 and how much further it has got to go before real production. And no, ramping down the CPU like only 1.2GHz for the Nexus 7 doesn't count.

Message.Title: Surface Win RT $499 model Sold Out Again Online At Best Buy
Message.Msg: This is the 3rd time since Microsoft launched the Surface Pro - $899 without Office. But hey you can rent office for only $99/year. I guess people like paying $499 and getting Office included. Can't wait for Microsoft to release a Surface with Tegra 4. These Intel chip prices are so way over the top and with Geekbench2 benchmarks equal to an Intel mobile I5 part#3317u why pay $400 more and you don't even get Office for free. Tegra 4 - 4592, Intel I5 #3317u - 4679 in those Geekbench2 benchmarks As Jensen says "Win RT Rocks on Tegra 4". Was that a hint of what's coming?

Topic.Title: Surface Win RT $499 model Sold Out Again Online At Best Buy

Topic.Title: Surface Win RT $499 model Sold Out Again Online At Best Buy

Plus they released Surface RT in all the European Countries in late Feb. and India and some Asian countries are close to release dates. Intel Pro is still US and Canada only........ But what was expected and does it really matter...that's the bear trap that people love to play. Topic.Title: Surface Win RT $499 model Sold Out Again Online At Best Buy

Message.Msg: "Tegra 4 with equivalent benchmarks to Intel's mobile I5 processor. " How I hope that holds... But an A15, with load/store and a small register set would seem to me to be at a BIG disadvantage for speed compared to an I5... However, INtel's recent touting of javascript benchmark, after javascript benchmark has a LOT to do with more optimized javascript SW that INtel invested heavily in... Tegra 4 has NVidia's own optimized javascript...

Topic.Title: Surface Win RT $499 model Sold Out Again Online At Best Buy

Message.Msg: In the case of Surface RT, pricing is not the only "make or break" factor.. Most people who want a Surface RT are going for its Office Suite, and most consumers who want the Office Suite would like it compliant with Windows legacy apps - this is not NVIDIA's fault, nor Microsoft's, and it just takes time to bridge the gap and time is in RT's favor. MS's got to start the first step and it has. With Tegra 4 showing such raw power, I wouldn't be surprised if MS and NV are already busy working on Surface II. We shouldn't expect any announcements until close to the product release, however, as smart observers would notice that this is way the game is being played nowadays.
